She could feel the hunter start the slide down her gullet grasping wildly at the fleshy surface. With a final swallow her prey began its descent, a bulge filling her throat before moving towards her stomach.

Her belly distended a bit as the human reached her stomach. The vixen enjoyed how he was struggling in her belly, unable to get out. "Serves him right!" She thought to herself as she regained her composure. Looking around, however, she noticed that the only human near her was the one wriggling in her belly. "I let the other one get away..." She lamented. She had a plan for that one too! Crushing a small bush in frustration she suddenly picked up a scent. "Maybe I didn't let him get away!" Sniffing wildly at the ground she picked up a smell that was undeniably human. She began to move, sniffing and sniffing until she reached a tree. Moving her head closer to the tree she could hear the sound of someone breathing really heavily behind it.

With a foxy grin she snapped her jaws over the tree, her new size giving her the strength to completely dislodge the tree from the ground. Chucking the tree to the side of her wish a massive crash she could plainly see the other human crouched down with his hands over his head. Stamping her black paws to the side of him the man practically jumped in the air before landing on his back, his eyes meeting the vixen's. She almost wanted to thank him for not running away as she raised one of her paws above him before gently lowering it back down onto him. Her paw took up his entire chest.

Apply pressure to the man's torso he lets out a sharp gasp. The fox was enjoying her display of dominance, applying pressures to different parts of his body to see what other sounds he makes. Unfortunately the fox overestimated how big she would be when she made her revenge plan. She was hoping that the human would be a bit smaller so her finale had more impact. As soon as the thought finished in her mind however she felt the man's form under her paws get smaller and smaller. Shocked she looked down. She wasn't growing, the man was shrinking! He stopped getting smaller by the time her paws completely encompassed him. Lifting her paw she inspected her diminished prey.

"So growing bigger isn't the only new power I got." She told herself as she watched the human. To test she imagined the human getting even smaller, making him yell out as his body started shrinking once again. She observed the human getting smaller and smaller until she had to crouch down to see him. To the man, the world around him looked foreign and strange, now standing only an inch tall small twigs were like logs and the small patch of dirt he was sitting on was like a massive hill. Looking upwards, the fox was impossibly tall. As the fox rose up to it's full height he was reminded of his first time in the big city, looking at the buildings towering over him in awe. The awe was quickly replaced with fear again as a huge shadow jolted him back to reality. Tumbling onto his back he watched as everything above him was replaced with a gigantic leathery pawpad. The leathery ceiling above him hovered for a second before abruptly smashing down on top of him. He didn't even feel anything as the fox squashed him flat.

With the other hunter taken care of, the fox took a moment to appreciate her work. The hunters that had tried to kill her were now defeated, one digesting in her belly while the other was turned to a small stain on her paw. The adrenaline rush of complete dominance lingered in her mind. She wanted to continue her revenge! Not only have the humans tried to kill her, but they constantly damaged the forest and killed other animals for sport. With the power to manipulate the size of herself and the humans she figured that they would be powerless to stop her. If they did manage hurt her all she had to do was make herself bigger so they couldn't anymore.

With her mind set on destruction she began her journey towards civilization.
1551122211.title: Outfoxed

1553.content:
The Incredible Animal Apparatus: A scientist has created an apparatus that allows people to read the minds of animals. However, things take a turn for the worst, or possibly the better, when you discover that the device still has a few kinks to be worked out: it has a special setting that wants the animals that you focus it on to become as giant as their imaginations let them, and it is able to give it to them with your consent, and possibly more!

School for Study: On your first day back from school, your teacher has announced that they have had the great honor to bring in an animal whose species is known for their incredible growth rate.
1553.title: More Choices

15532.content: Which animal has your teacher brought in?
15532.title: School for Study

choices: extremely powerful, but gentle as well
155321.content:
You eventually make it to school.

Today, you are studying... Lions!

As you take your seat, you find out that your teacher was able to get permission to bring in a lion cub.

However, this cub has the unique feature of being...
155321.title: Studying

choices: "begin to age to the look of a full grown lion, but not grow yet."
1553212.content:
As he is brought into the classroom, the cub continues to play with a little stuffed elephant.

"This," the teacher says, "Is a rare variety of lion, known as the Colossal American Lion."

"This is a cub of the species, and as you can see, cubs are around the size of house cats. They are extremely playful, but also very gentle with non-lions."

"If you observe closely, you can see the tell-tale marking of a Colossal American Lion, the black tipped ears, with the golden body."

"Now, a Colossal American Lion's average full grown size is that of Mount Everest."

At this, many people in the classroom looked nervous.

"Do not worry, it takes a few years for it to grow that large."

"Now, at this point the cub is 1 year old. In four days, he'll..."
1553212.title: Colossal American Lions

15532121.content:
"You see, exactly one year and four days after its birth, the Colossal American Lion will mature rapidly, soon gaining its adult shape and mannerisms."

You look closely at it, and can see some strange bulge in its stomach, so you ask the teacher about it.

"Ah, yes, that is a phenomenon that appears before the maturing happens. The stomach swells in size, and the cub will eat an extraordinary amount the day before the change."

"Now, class is dismissed until four days from now. That's right, due to this new project, we will have school holidays for the next three days. Until then, one student may take him home with you."

"You see, the Colossal American Lions enjoy human companionship, and it has been found that a Colossal American Lion grows much larger in its final size when it lives with a human."

"Ok, the person to take him home will be..."
15532121.title: Day one is over

155321211.content:
You spend the next three days with anticipation. You have never wanted to go to school like you do now.

Finally, on the fourth day, school begins. The teacher enters, and takes roll.

"Alright class, it is time. Last night, the Colossal American Lion went through the change. You will notice a change in his mannerisms and shape. Please take notes as you observe."

You watch the door eagerly, and in comes the lion.

He has changed shape dramatically, changed to the shape of a full grown lion, and only slightly bigger than before. He now has a full bushy mane that was a deep rustic brown color. You notice that he seems to be stepping with more care, trying not to step on any bugs. It also seems to have greatly increased in strength, and its weight has also increased.

"Now, as you can see, it has mostly only changed in shape, with very little growth. Now that the change has happened, the lion will begin his growth spurt.

"Due to his amazingly rapid growth rate, if you look closely, you can actually see him growing this very instant."

You look very closely, and can see his huge paws taking up even more space on the floor tiles it is standing on

"Now, the next thing to happen is.."
155321211.title: Matured lion

1553212111.content:
"Now, if you watch closely, you'll notice a slight change in his mannerisms."

You look closely at him, and notice that he is growling and roaring, while pacing back and forth.

"This is the phase that comes right before a growth spurt. It is known as the "Waiting" phase. During the first Waiting phase, any human interaction will greatly change its eventual size and power."

"Now, a volunteer, please?" you raise your hand.

"Ah excellent, you will do fine." You are gestured to the front of the room.

"Now, please lie down in front of the lion. He will be curious about you and come up to you. If we're lucky, he'll lie on top of you. This is the signal that he will grow to the size of the earth at full size, and maybe even then some."

A student raises his hand. "Sir? Why would we want that?"

The teacher ponders this question. "You see, when the lion grows to the size of the earth, it gains the ability to control the entire earth with its thoughts. By getting a lion to this size, we can insure our race's survival."

Another student raises his hand. "Teacher? But wouldn't the lion just wipe out humans and replace them with lions?"

"A good question," the teacher states, "but a Colossal American Lion at that size still has a pet's intelligence. He will act as though the volunteer there," he points at you on the floor, "Is his best friend. As he is a human, the lion will treat all humans the same."

"Ahem, now, even if he does not lay on you, he will still start growing soon. Oh, and I almost forgot. If he does lie on you, you will be linked with him, and he with you. Neither of you will be able to go very far without the other."

Surprised, you continue to lie down, now looking forward to this a bit more. Your own lion god! Oh boy!

The question is, is he going to lie down on you?
1553212111.title: God lion-to-be

15532121111.content:
You continue to lie on the floor, your anticipation mounting greatly. You are very pleased to hear the lion walking over to you and soon see him coming from the corner of your vision. Before you know it, his immense weight somehow lies gently on top of you, and you feel the incredible warmth of his fur.

"Excellent!" the teacher yells as the lion stands back up on all fours and the class claps and cheers. "We'll finally be able to learn a lot more about this fascinating species firsthand, but, more importantly the human race's survival is now assured . He'll definitely "grow up" to be the ultimate class project!" The class laughed loudly, and even the lion seemed to smile as he stood in the center of all the students.

"Now don't forget," the teacher says as the laughter dies down, "now that he has chosen to lay on you-" he motions to you, "-the Colossal American Lion will now grow about twice his previous height every 24 hours until he is the size of the earth. Once he has grown to that size, it will be his decision, as well as yours, if he grows even larger or not."

"This is the only behavioral aspect of the Colossal American Lion that has not been studied yet, since no one has even seen a lion grow to this size of course. The only information humans have of this species is from laboratory testing in a controlled environment with constant human interaction, and the projection of the lions' sizes was simply extraordinary. Ultimately, the scientists concluded that they grow about twice as large in frequent intervals after they are one year and four days old."

"Now, I trust that you will bring the lion to school every day while you're on vacation so that the rest of the class and I can record down observations?" asks the teacher rhetorically.

You nod, but it is mostly from shock. Did he just say that he was giving you, and only you, another vacation?

"Yes, that's right," the teacher chuckles, "as a special treat, you're going to get as much time off as needed in order to take care of and bond with the lion. That way we can assure it's maximum growth and happiness."

The rest of the class gives you looks of utter jealousy and longing, and you smile knowing that the lion has chosen you to be its best friend.

"However, I want you to be especially careful and adapt along with the lion as efficiently as possible. A growing lion is going to need more and more food, space, and companionship each and every day. I'm certain though that you will do just fine. Are you up to the job?" he asks.

You nod eagerly, instantly becoming fixated on the clock, counting down the minutes until the end of the school day.

"Just don't forget to bring him in every day so we can record his progress!" he said, and you nod once more.

Finally, the end of school comes and you walk out of the classroom door with your new lion companion on his special leash that the teacher had designed for him just as a precaution. You know that he will soon grow to about 12 feet tall by tomorrow since he is already 6 feet tall, and you are eager to go home and make the accommodations needed for him.

Once you get home, you head to your room to push all the furniture to one side of the room, lay the ground with blankets, and find huge watering tubs outside to put the lion's meat and water in. There's now plenty of space for him to sprawl out on the comfy floor, and you are content that he is content. He instantly curls up on the floor and falls asleep peacefully.

You think about what your parents would say, but luckily your parents were on an extended vacation too and wouldn't be back home for a few weeks, so you wouldn't have to worry about keeping the lion a secret.

So, what should you do now? It is getting late and you're exhausted from preparing for your lion friend.
15532121111.title: The beginning of a beautiful relationship

choices: Go online and research Colossal American Lions
Lie in your bed quietly until he wakes up
155321211111.content:
You're so excited about your new lion that even when you are physically exhausted you still find it hard to sleep. Eventually, your mind drifts off and you wake up to the bright light that pours into your room every morning.

You jump out of bed, knowing it's the start of your vacation and plan to spend as much quality time with your lion as possible. You're also hoping that he's bigger than he was last night, but with a quick glance at his sleeping frame you could tell he was still 6 feet tall. Since he grows bigger every 24 hours, it probably won't be until midday before he begins his next growth spurt. He looked kind of cute in a powerful sort of way as he was curled in a ball in the corner of your room, breathing heavily.

Deciding that you don't want to disturb your lion while he's sleeping, you choose to do something quietly until he awakes. What do you want to do?

Lion licks you, don't know what it means, teacher tells later spontaneous growth
155321211111.title: Waking up

choices: Your Colossal American Lion will experience a massive growth rate if...
Learn to control your Colossal American Lion's size by...
1553212111111.content:
You decide to hop on the computer, rather quietly as to not disturb your lion friend, and research the Colossal American Lion. You tiptoe across the room, sit down in your computer chair, and open up the internet. All the while you can hear your friend's breathing, and rather than making you nervous that such a large, carnivorous animal is laying right behind you, it actually soothes you to know that a trusted friend is there.

You type in "Colossal American Lions" in the search bar and look down at the links until one catches your eye. You open it and are amazed at all the artist renditioned pictures of absolutely gigantic lions, male and female, that fill up the bulk of the site. There are lions painted at many different sizes; some show lions about the size of a bus, others the size of mountains, and some as tall as the atmosphere itself. After browsing through all the pictures, you click on one of the many different links to the left entitled "The habits of the Colossal American Lion." As you read, you eventually scroll down and a heading catches your eye:
1553212111111.title: Research

15532121111112.content:
As you read on, you learn some very interesting facts about your friend lion's species. The web site says that, apparently, there has always been an ancient and mysterious artifact that has the ability to increase the size of the Colossal American Lion by the Chosen One of the species, and only the Chosen One. It says the artifact has been hidden away "in the birthplace of the Lions," but does not say specifically where it is. In a side note though it says that if the Chosen One is ever alive anywhere in the planet all they would have to do is focus and believe that such an artifact exists and it will appear to them.

Your mind races as you think back during school. The lion did lie on you, didn't it? And no one else had any control over him, right? Then perhaps you were the Chosen One!

In your excitement, you quickly log off the computer and nearly knock over the chair but soon gain back your balance. You look over at your 6 foot tall friend still sleeping near the corner of your room, and your insides seem to swell with impending pride and excitement from just thinking about having the power to change your friend's size on the slightest whim. An artifact must exist for your sole use, it must...

In a flash, your room glowed a pearly white for about a few seconds as an object the size of your wrist materialized in front of you. You had to shield your eyes with your arm quickly as to not get dazed. Once you open them, you find yourself looking at a thick, bronze-colored wristband suspended in midair. It didn't seem to have an inclination of malevolence to it, so you decide to walk forward and investigate.

A dim red glow was encased around the ancient wristband. As you got even closer you noticed unusual markings and hieroglyphs that completely covered its bronze surface. The carvings seemed to have been cut out thousands of years ago, most likely by the early American aborigines. Running along the side of the bronze wristband as if telling a story, they depicted the struggle that both man and lion had so many centuries ago. The first "slide" showed men attacking a defenseless adult lion. The second showed a glowing object appearing between them, and the third showed what looked like a paw of the lion filling up the right side of the slide while all the men, except for one wearing the device, cowered on the left. Finally, the fourth showed thousands of men bowing down to a massive lion the size of a mountain while a tiny man sat on his bushy mane.

Intrigued by these pictures and drawing a complete blank at the hieroglyphs, you decide to hop back online again to see if you could find out more about this. Sure enough, there is a link on the left of the same page entitled "The Great Device." You click on it and continue you to read while the lion behind you continues his peaceful sleep.

The website tells you that lions did indeed exist in America around a few thousand years ago. Lions and humans lived surprisingly well along side each other and each species coexisted well for a long time. However, once humans decided that they were a source of meat, their numbers were quickly depleted due to excessive hunting. Just when hope seemed lost for the lions it is said that a Great Device appeared before the only man that fought for the protection of the lions that allowed him to change the lions' sizes. He grew one of the powerful males to demonstrate the power of the lions, changed him back to normal size once the people respected the lions, and then hid the device so carefully that only the next Chosen One would be able to find it. Only a few of the lions survived the onslaught by the humans and spent centuries deep in the American forests away from human eyes because of their habit of growing from any human interaction because of the after effects of the Device.

Everything made sense to you now. This made you extremely excited and eager to test out the Great Device as the new Chosen One. You get up, walk over to the center of the room, wrap the Device around your wrist, and are immediately overcome with a light feeling, a feeling as though you could do anything.

You walk over to your sleeping friend, scratch his mane, and see him give a huge yawn as he wakes up. He looks up at you and stands up on all fours excitedly upon seeing your own excited smile; he must know that something is going on. He gives a quick stretch of his front legs, his claws digging into the carpeted floor, and then fully stands up, becoming eye level with you.

"Look what I have, buddy!" you say, holding your arm so he can see the Device. His eyes grow huge upon seeing it and lets out a small growl of understanding. He must know what it is because of his obvious eagerness for something to happen.

Fluffy white fur covered its hooves, reaching down from its fetlocks. By far the most distinctive feature of the tiny horse was, well, just how tiny it was. The foal was the size of a small cat, and so frail and thin that it looked as if it hadn't eaten a single thing in its life.

Your teacher told your class to gather in a circle at the carpeted area in the class, and you as did so she began to explain what the horse was as she stood in the middle of you and your classmates. "This," she said, "is a Great Draft Horse." The eyes of all of your classmates - and indeed, yours - widened, all of them letting out a gasp almost in unison. Everyone knew about the Great Draft Horses. After all, why was the sky black or brown or grey sometimes? Because one of the immense horses was in your area and probably looking for attention.

"This one's a baby boy, what's called a foal. I'm going to take his leash off so he can meet all of you - don't be scared of him, Great Drafts are incapable of being mean!" Your teacher slipped the collar off of the teeny horse and it immediately began to nicker and snort, running off in random directions, constantly halting and cantering in another direction. Too many children to make friends with, too many children to snuggle with!

The foal canters in a ring, brushing up against any of your classmates it can reach. "Of course, he's only a baby, so he's going to get much bigger," you teacher continues. "Contact with humans is extremely important for Great Drafts, so we've been allowed to take care of him. In fact, one of you will be taking him home with you!" The class instantly explodes into s flurry of shouting and hand-waving, but your teacher quickly gets your classmates to quiet down.

"As Great Drafts are intelligent enough to understand humans, the horse himself will be allowed to choose who he wants to go home with."

At that, the horse whinnied, twisting and turning his head this way and that. Your heart skips a beat as his eyes lock onto you, the foal slowly making his way towards you. You gawp, open-mouthed, as he settles into your lap, like a cat. You move your hands down to him, letting him all over. "Great Drafts mature and grow extremely quickly, so he'll look different every time he's brought into the class," your teacher says. Attracting your attention, she continues. "I'll tell your parents, though I have a feeling they'll be more than enthusiastic about this. They'll be getting food and water for the Great Draft so you might have to wait after school for a little bit."

As it turns out, though, you didn't have to wait after school. Immediately after getting home, you fed and watered the foal, and retreated to your room with him. You took your time playing with him, wondering if he'd get tired out - but the foal seemed to have limitless energy, and when not playing some game with you was cantering and bounding throughout the room, as if he's explode if he didn't use up some of the energy inside of him.

Suddenly, however, the tiny Draft halted in place, shuddering as you looked on. Was he about to grow? Your teacher had said that'd happen when he went like this... As it turned out, he was going to do more than just grow. The little horse clambered up onto your bed, equine muscles all twitching, before his hide suddenly pulled tight, struggling to cover all of his body before it caught up. The size of a small cat moments before, the horse had leapt up in size to being about as big as a husky dog. He looked different, too. You weren't sure how to describe it but he seemed stronger.

Another shudder, and the horse grew once more. His shining eyes met yours as he grew last your sitting form's head, starting to nuzzle down on you eagerly. His growth was accompanied by the sound of rubber being pulled tight. You liked that sound - it was nice.

You knew why the horse looked different, now - he wasn't just growing, he was growing up! His eyes shot open and his big muzzle swung around to look between his hind legs. Peeking around his body and following his gaze, you gasped. Two tennis ball-sized spheres hung from the underside of the horse's body towards the back, a fuzzy brown cylinder attached to them. As you watched, a bulge of pink flesh spilled out of the fuzzy sheath, limp and dangling free, before more hot-pink flesh began to push out, forcing the sheath to expand to contain its growing size.

"Your... Willy?" you mumble as you look at it, the horse shuffling about in what seemed to be the need to do something with it. Not needing to pee - something else. "Wow, it's so big..." The horse's entire body let out a creaking sound as your eyes widened further, what you recognised as muscle freely swelling all over him. Existing muscles gained definition and size, booming larger, and his body packed in new muscles wherever they could fit.

The horse jumped off of your bed with a heavy thud, the little stallion taller than you when standing by now. He nickered happily as he looked at you, before looking back at his willy. Even soft, it seemed to reach halfway to the floor. It started to harden, and a sloshing sound came from his balls as he shifted about.

He had to be a teenager by now, if not more! You realised then that you wanted him to be the biggest Great Draft Horse ever - bigger than any other!

Things like plushies, stuffed animals and so on - you'd outgrown them just after childhood, but could never quite bring yourself to actually get rid of them despite never playing with them. Nostalgia, most likely. Too many fun memories of playing with them. There were three toys in particular that you played with almost constantly: three plush horses, named Maximus, Billy, and Colton. In the games you'd played with them as a child, you'd given them all distinct personalities to make them more distinct than their different colours would indicate. Colton was a farm horse with light brown fur and a black mane; in your games, he was a hard worker, to the point that anything stopping him from working on the farm either disappeared or caused him to grow bigger and stronger, to the point that he could simply disregard it. Billy - also known as Big Billy - was a dapple grey stallion and a racehorse. Not only was he the fastest horse in the world, but he was a serious contender for the second largest. Every race, whether a win or a loss, caused his body to adapt so as to make him more successful in future races - every race grew him bigger, stronger, faster!

Maximus, though, was something else entirely. Big enough to make houses look like toy models; strong enough to lift anything he could see. With a fur and mane as black as midnight, Maximus was so large that any area he was in was plunged into darkness, his shadow enveloping the ground beneath him. Not only that, but the black stallion was constantly growing. In fact, nearly everything he did only made him bigger - eating, drinking; even things like breathing and running only made him ever larger.

...Yeah. Looking back on it, it wasn't unexpected that you were into macro. So many sessions playing with your toys and pretending that they were immense, evergrowing giants was probably an early indicator of your proclivities.

Talking about your toys, you were currently digging through a box of your old plushies. You'd decided to dig out your old toy horses and clean them up a bit, after so many years of them languishing at the bottom of a fluffy toy pile. It doesn't take long for you to find Maximus, Billy and Colton, as they were rather large toys - plushie horses that, even at your adult height, were still large enough to consider snuggling with. You arranged them in a row, in size order: Maximus, Billy, and then Colton.

Smiling nostalgically, you pick up Maximus, cradling the plush toy against your chest. Squeezing it tight, you lower your head into its mane, breathing in through your nose. You had expected several things when taking your old toys out of their box in the attic: that they'd be dirt or covered in dust, possibly damaged - but you had not expected for Maximus to lean into you and start licking your cheek.

Your pet cat had been missing for almost over a week. You came home one day to find that Patches, your pet cat, didn't run out to greet you and beg loudly for food like he always does. Systematically searching the house, the backyard and even the nearby park you found no hide nor hair of him. After a few days you resigned to putting up posters of him in the hopes somebody found him. Thankfully, someone did. A call early in the night woke you from your slumber on the couch, the dim colors from your TV illuminating your room. Grasping at your phone, you finally hit the answer button and bring it up to your ear. Your drowsiness was quickly replaced with joy when you heard the lady on the phone say the words "We found your cat". The lady which worked at a vet halfway across town said that the cat he was identified as yours from the microchip in his neck and she continued to explain that he was found unconscious in an alleyway and made a full recovery at the clinic.

Throwing a cat cage into your car you set out into the night, thankful for the lack of traffic on the otherwise busy roads. A half-hour drive later you arrive. After asking about Patches and being ushered into another office you see your bengal cat sitting patiently on a steel table. When the cat notices you he runs over and rubs against your legs, giving you the opportunity to scoop him up in your arms. "Oof!" you blurt out as your adjust him in your arms. "How does a cat that's gone missing for a week gain weight?"

"He's very lucky," the vet said, "As I said over the phone we found him passed out in an alleyway. It was only when a tenant living next to that huge pharmaceutical company was taking out the trash they found him." Her face suddenly turned grim. "I'm not saying it was those Factoreu Lab guys, but a whole bunch of animals have been going missing ever since they showed up." Clearing her throat and putting on a smile she pushed a clipboard and paperwork to you. "Just sign these, please."

With everything in order you put Patches into the cat cage you brought and put him in the car and set off for home. On the way back you spot the alley the vet lady was talking about, right next to the pharmaceutical company. Dull lights shined ominously on the side of the rectangular building, illuminating the words 'Factoreu Labs. Groundbreaking Medicines and Advancements'. The building seemingly popped up overnight one day catching everyone off guard with its sterile, brutalist design, contrasting the old surrounding apartments. Shoving thoughts of the lab to the back of your mind you soon arrive back to your house and reintroduce Patches. Pouring him some pellets, you were extremely glad he was found.

Checking the time you found it was pretty late so you head to bed, leaving the door open a crack to let Patches come in and sleep on you like he always does. Before long you drift off to sleep, unaware of the changes that were starting to occur to your lovable bengal.

1553322222222222222.content:
Last Light:

Another variant of Creation Ability, in Last Light you are the only human remaining on earth due to your immortality, as the planet had been abandoned eons ago. One day, however, in an ancient ruin, you stumble across a book of spells that claim to allow you to summon spirit animals, eternal companions that will be forever loyal and will always be at your side. Little do you know, that spirit animals tend to get very...large, over time.
1553322222222222222.title: Last Light

15533222222222222221.content:
You pull the black cloak over you leave the shelter of the half-rotted wooden cabin that had been your home for the past two hundred years or so. The sodden earth underneath your feet squelches as you move, and the near-torrential downpour starts to seep through your cloak.

After nearly an hour of walking you come across a stone building. Now that was odd. Almost all stone had been eroded centuries ago, yet this building stood unblemished. You pushed the wooden door open and looked inside.

There was a simple, nearly unfurnished room meeting your eyes. A small round table was positioned in the middle of the room, and a book lay upon it. You pick up the book and examine it. It had black covers, a red spine and gold writing on the front.

You flip it open and begin to read, realizing it is instructions for something. You continue to examine it and realize it is telling you how to summon a 'spirit animal'.

Do you summon a spirit animal now, or wait until you get back to your house?
15533222222222222221.title: Spirit Animals

155332222222222222212.content:
You close the book abruptly as dust particles scattered across the room. You placed the book gently into your satchel. As you headed home the light started to feign more darker. You walk briskly, reminding slightly of what you would give to have horses in this world again. "What I would give to have another companion by my side." You talked back to yourself, which happened quite often, since there was no living creature living on Earth for millenniums.
You stopped griping as you ran back to your cabin and hastily opened the door. Seeing the sun was still setting, you lit a candle and placed it on your desk. You set the satchel on your chair and opened to reveal a seemingly old book, yet it couldn't look more than a couple hundred years. "Impossible." You exclaimed. You put the book on the table and carefully read the old English writing.

Summoning Spirit Animal

It plainly said with no signed authorship, as you opened to the introduction. Where it began to illustrate the beginning of this Earth as it was created, a story you should be very familiar. It explained Mother of Nature who was the architect to build this world and assigned it to one individual to take care of as long as it blossomed it's fruit. You smiled with a little self-indulgence as it spoke of you with high honor. This was weird of course since no living mortal man was to know the truth of the eternal plan. That was explained carefully as Mother never wanted anyone to know of Her. You began to remind yourself of the times She was here on Earth, and beauty that She saw in it. Tears fell trying to forget what would later happen with her. However the point was, who could've written this book. You began to think someone was still watching over you, maybe they wanted you to have this book.
You read on. The Mother later feeling a force of fear of the creatures She created which was the Humans you knew so well, as they were so unrelentingly wicked in their deeds to one another. Heartbroken She fled her Light from Earth and carried out her work other places. You didn't want to read anymore since it was truly a dark time in your life when she left, Earth was just never the same without her. However you continued. She didn't leave the Earth without supervision of course, it began to talk about Her creating Spirit Animals that would watch over the world without Her. With the looks of the pages there were hundreds of creatures that She created, which was a thing you never knew about. Was this book for real? Were they still watching Earth even now? You had to know. You looked through the faded drawings as you tried to tell what they looked like. Some looked like a collection of different animals that had one body. However varying they were, you noticed that they all had one exact same feature, they were all female. It took a while of flipping until you realized that was the case. Even though you had both men and women relationships, you were happy to have a companion after so long.
You came across one that looked more faded than the rest. You could make out it looked like the top half of a goat with horns, with yellow eyes and red pupils. The bottom half looked like a horse's. The more you tried to make out what the name said and the picture the more you wanted to know what it really looked like. You stood up and picked up the book as you read off the incantation to summon her. As you finished you didn't feel any significance of what you said. You looked around and even checked all around your house and yard, but no sign of a creature besides yourself. A little disappointed you were to tired to be angry. You shut the book and left it on the desk as you blew the candle out. You noticed it was dark and so you made your way to your bed. You lay there wondering maybe in the morning you find a Spirit Animal knocking at your door.
155332222222222222212.title: A New Companion

155332222222222222222111.content:
Glancing at your shiny Pokedex as it shines in the sunlight, you smile before eagerly grabbing hold of a pokeball on your belt. You hold it forward before saying, "Inferno! I choose you!"

The pokeball opens and with a burst of red light your Charizard materializes before you, letting out a short, deep roar and smiling down at you. Inferno was already very big and strong, even for usual Charizard standards: Standing at over six and a half feet tall and nearly every inch bulging from muscle (save for his lightly pudgy belly), Inferno was an exceptional specimen indeed. You couldn't help but get a sense of satisfaction whenever you sent him out to the battlefield, almost always laughing when you caught glances of the faces of the other trainers and their Pokemon.

Coming out of your short reverie, you look back up into your Charizard's eyes.

"Anyway, I have a gift for you."

Inferno looks at you curiously, eager to receive whatever you planned to present him with.

"We'll, technically, it's two gifts. One gift will make you... stronger. A lot stronger, even though you're probably already the strongest Charizard I've ever seen. The second will make it a lot easier to communicate with others, including humans and trainers like me. You do want these, do you?"

He nods rapidly, moving slightly closer to you as he awaits to be gifted with even more strength, and ease of communication.

"Hold up a second! Which do you want first, the strength, or the easier communication? Nod once for strength, and twice for communication."

Inferno briefly reflects on what it wants first, and...
155332222222222222222111.title: Your Charizard, Inferno

1553322222222222222221111.content:
The Charizard nods once. Oh, goody...

You aim your Pokedex at the expectant fire dragon and press the button labelled grow.

Almost immediately, a beam shoots out at Inferno, who is initially startled, but quickly starts to enjoy his growth as he passes seven foot even within seconds, his deep growls that progressively grew louder and louder filling the air. Inferno snorts as he passes eight feet tall, shivering in pleasure before he passes nine feet, then ten feet!

The increasingly massive Charizard huffs and growls in joy as he passes fifteen feet tall before another two feet pile onto him, then another three! Deciding that this is big enough for now, you take your thumb off the growth button as he "Rrrrr"'s from feeling the pleasant after effects of growth.

Inferno only now realizes his size compared to everything else. Looking down at you, you hear a repeating growling noise that was probably his version of chuckling. Looking around, the Charizard is able to look over the tops of even the tallest trees in the area.

Sitting down, he delights in the fact that he still towered over you, and pats his massive lap, inviting you to sit in it. You do so, and Inferno turns you around to face him. Pointing at you, he...
1553322222222222222221111.title: Rising Dragon

choices: Choose another one of your Pokemon to grow!
Stay with Inferno! More growth, or speech.
15533222222222222222211111.content:
You grin with excitement as Inferno nods at you once, all too eager to make him even bigger! It's clear that your Pokemon shares your excitement, his large chest heaving with his rapid panting as his warm breath washes over you, his eyes gleaming as they gaze down at you. You lift the Pokedex with a trembling hand and press the grow button once more, Inferno growling happily as the beam strikes him and his body shudders before resuming its growth. His toe-claws curl with delight as his legs slowly stretch across the ground while his hands drag deep gouges along the grassy earth, the dragon lifting his head and closing his eyes as he relishes the increasing mass. You watch with excited amazement as he huffs and growls with pure pleasure, feeling his body quiver and expand below you, while his muscles bulk and push out against his skin. As you lean out to see behind the growing Charizard you see his powerful tail grow thicker and longer in short, delightful spurts, whipping and curling around trees while the flame at the tip grows stronger and brighter to show his increasing vitality. Your starter Pokemon had to be at least 25 feet tall now!

Your world suddenly grows dark as Inferno uses his hands to press you against his belly in an enormous hug, his head bowing forward, snorting with happiness as his back reaches the edge of the tree line. You let yourself sink into his swelling form, your finger stuck against the grow button, grinning as you hear the trees creak and groan as they are slowly but surely overpowered by the enormous dragon's rear. You can hear his whole body rumbling and creaking with muffled, organic sounds as it grows and swells against you, Inferno snorting and huffing just behind you. Soon the trees are overwhelmed, snapping at the trunk with loud, sudden cracks or ripping out of the ground by their roots. Inferno releases you as he pulls up to roar in victory, spreading his wings, his voice so deep you feel it reverberate in your chest.

As you fall back onto Inferno's leg in a daze your finger slips from the button and the Charizard shudders to a halt at just over 30 feet, dominating his immediate surroundings. You smile as you enjoy how happy your Pokemon is, growling and huffing with happiness as his huge eyes meet yours again.
15533222222222222222211111.title: Increasing Inferno

155332222222222222222222221.content:
Deep inside an advanced animal research facility, scientists have successfully genetically altered a batch of animals to grow larger. With a more efficient metabolism and a heightened appetite, the scientists have recorded that energy intakes such as eating food dramatically boosts the growth of their bodies beyond their species natural size. Their size was manageable and after finishing their testing they managed to halt their growth until there was all but one more animal waiting hungrily in it's cramped cage.

In their hubris, they decided to test how far they could push an animal to grow and put the lone specimen under even more gene therapy. Off the books, the small scientist team hid their experiment in a dark room and kept the voracious animal fed, eagerly awaiting results before they brought up the idea with the board of directors. The results come in faster than they anticipated, however...

Who are you in this scenario?

info.brief_description: Storylines of gigantic and growing anthros and animals abound!
info.description:
Pick or create your own unique storyline in which animals and anthros grow.

**While I highly encourage as many good contributions to this story as possible, I still want to lay down some ground rules:

1) More "adult" themes are welcome, but please try to focus on the growth and the story as well as the relationships between the animals/anthros and other characters - even straight out smutty growth stories are just that much better when a good, descriptive story is involved. =)

2) Animal to anthro transformation is allowed, and sometimes even encouraged!

3) Violence and/or rampaging is acceptable as well, but again, see Rule #1.

4) Real life and fantasy animals/anthros, as well as those from media, are all more than welcome.

5) Other growth is fine as well - muscle, genital, inflation, etc. - but again, try to focus mostly on height/size growth.

6) Please try to have at least one developed paragraph for each chapter, unless it's a choice chapter, of course. Small and couple-sentence chapters might be removed.

7) Many of these story ideas are heavily influenced by Kardo's original "Giant Friendly Animals" story, and I (and ask other writers to do the same) will give credit where credit is due.

Have fun, and please let me know of any suggestions/comments/concerns you may have!
info.pretty_title: Tales of Giant Anthros and Animals
